meanings.definition: A person who believes themselves to be superior to others in taste or social status.
meanings.sent1: The snobs at the party only talked to people they thought were important.
meanings.sent2: Some snobs refuse to shop at certain stores because they think they are too good for them.
meanings.sent3: The snobs in the group turned up their noses at the homemade cookies, preferring only fancy desserts.
meanings.sent4: She was a snob when it came to fashion, always looking down on those who didn't wear designer labels.
meanings.sent5: The snobs in the exclusive club would only associate with those from wealthy families.

meanings.definition: To behave in a superior manner towards others.
meanings.sent1: He snobs his classmates by always bragging about his expensive vacations.
meanings.sent2: Don't snob your friends just because you think you are better than them.
meanings.sent3: She tends to snob her coworkers by constantly correcting their mistakes in a condescending way.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity snobs the paparazzi, refusing to acknowledge their presence.
meanings.sent5: The wealthy businessman snobs the salespeople in the store, treating them as if they are beneath him.
